item.title: Gregorian Calendar
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Lmfao, it was for my delta double exp weekend. [code=Java]---------------------------
Find

Can’t find the text:

“weekend”

OK

[/code]Er, wtf? Stupid Notepad++. public final void getDoubleEXPWeekend() { Calendar calendar = new GregorianCalendar(); int day = calendar.get(Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK); doubleEXPWeekend = false; if (day > 5) { doubleEXPWeekend = true; SERVER_EXP_BONUS = 2; return; } else if (day < 3) { doubleEXPWeekend = true; SERVER_EXP_BONUS = 2; return; } SERVER_EXP_BONUS = 1; }EDIT: I’m pretty sure it works on Friday now. I tested it today, and it works. I just got to see if it goes through on Saturday, Sunday, and make sure it doesn’t show up on Monday.

item.title: Gregorian Calendar
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Even if you figured it out, this may help others:

I believe the Gregorian Calendar has Sunday set as the default start of the week, making Sunday zero.

So, 0, 6, and 7 would be our days.

if (day < 6 && day != 0) { System.out.println("This is either Friday, Saturday, or Sunday"); }[/quote]
I got confused o.O So if the day is not Sunday, it will print saying it’s Sunday?
